channel.title: Newegg Open-Box
channel.description: [font=verdana][size=13px]Does anyone have experience with Newegg's open-box items? The policy lists cosmetic defects including dings and scratches. What kind of condition can I expect (not guaranteed)?[/size][/font]

item.title: Newegg Open-Box
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

[quote=“Travas, post:9, topic:502410”][quote author=ox random xi link=topic=620638.msg4249519#msg4249519 date=1362267787]

Why read customer reviews? often times it’s the manufacturer who is commenting on their own product

I’ve found their reviews helpful. And actually, you see lots of people saying the bad problems of the product. I find it quite honest.
[/quote]I had to build 6 computers for a highschool class, and give reliability ratings for each and every part. If I showed up with a bunch of customer reviews in my presentation, I would have been fired lol[/quote]
Not so much that, but when I’m browsing for something I read offsite and onsite reviews.

Read full topic

item.title: Newegg Open-Box
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:10, topic:502410”]You can always try eBay. I got a NVIDIA GeForce GT 240 for $30 and it’s like new and performs great for everything I do.[/quote]Already bought a different one. I only have a 300w PSU (I know…) so I had to be careful which card I got (although most of the time your system doesn’t use close to the watts the power supply can support) to make sure I don’t burn anything out.

I got this one if you’re interested:

newegg.com

HIS iCooler Radeon HD 7750 DirectX 11 H775FS2G 2GB 128-Bit DDR3 PCI Express 3.0...

Buy HIS iCooler Radeon HD 7750 DirectX 11 H775FS2G 2GB 128-Bit DDR3 PCI Express 3.0 x16 HDCP Ready Video Card with fast shipping and top-rated customer service.Once you know, you Newegg!

It’s pretty decent from what I’ve seen, it’s not high end but it’s not low end. It’ll play the games I wanna play. Also comes with a free game

Read full topic

You can always try eBay. I got a NVIDIA GeForce GT 240 for $30 and it’s like new and performs great for everything I do.

item.title: Newegg Open-Box
item.dc:creator: @ox_random_xi ox random xi
item.description:
@ox_random_xi wrote:

HcoJustin:

I don’t like newegg. I just bought a brand new card from them and it came DoA with the box beat to hell. Their RMA process is fast but I’d advise a different seller if you can.

NewEgg has amazing customer support plus you get automatic manufacture warranty on what you buy so it shouldn’t really matter. I’ve dealt with NewEgg on maybe over 50 instances and they’ve surpassed my expectations. Also - always read customer reviews.

[quote=“Travas, post:5, topic:502410”][quote author=HcoJustin link=topic=620638.msg4249331#msg4249331 date=1362249605]
I don’t like newegg. I just bought a brand new card from them and it came DoA with the box beat to hell. Their RMA process is fast but I’d advise a different seller if you can.
[/quote]when i ordered parts for 6 computers from newegg for my school, the boxes for the cases were beat to hell (nothing was damaged, though) and everything else came fine.

Anyhow, I found a different graphics card that isn’t opened or used.

EDIT: I also use directron.com and tigerdirect.com. I go to whichever one has the lower price for the item, which happens to be newegg.[/quote]
The box problem sounds like it isn’t NewEgg’s fault, more like the shipping handler. NewEgg offers daily deals which can be pretty awesome, I’ve picked up misc. stuff that I randomly needed almost up to 70% off.

Read full topic

Anyhow, I found a different graphics card that isn’t opened or used.

EDIT: I also use directron.com and tigerdirect.com. I go to whichever one has the lower price for the item, which happens to be newegg.
